page.title: Gochang, Hwasun and Ganghwa Dolmen Sites

revision.text:
{{Infobox UNESCO World Heritage Site | image = Korea-Ganghwado-Dolmen-01.jpg | image_upright = 1.2 | caption = Dolmens at [[Ganghwa Island]] | location = [[South Korea]] | includes = | criteria = {{UNESCO WHS type|(iii)}}(iii) | ID = 977 | coordinates = {{coord|34|58|0|N|126|55|45|E|region:KR|display=title, inline|format=dms}} | year = 2000 | area = {{convert|51.65|ha|acre|abbr=on}} | buffer_zone = {{convert|314.55|ha|acre|abbr=on}} | locmapin = South Korea | map_caption = }} {{Infobox Korean name |img= |caption= |hangul={{linktext|고|창}} / {{linktext|화|순}} / {{linktext|강|화|지|석|묘|군}} |hanja ={{linktext|高|敞}} / {{linktext|和|順}} / {{linktext|江|華|支|石|墓|群}} |rr=Gochang / Hwasun / Ganghwa Jiseongmyogun |mr=Koch'ang / Hwasun / Kanghwa Chisŏngmyogun }} The '''Gochang, Hwasun and Ganghwa Dolmen Sites''' are the location of hundreds of stone [[dolmen]] which were used as grave markers and for ritual purposes during the first millennium BCE when the Megalithic Culture was prominent on the [[Korean Peninsula]]. The sites were designated as a [[World Heritage]] Site by [[UNESCO]] in 2000. [[Korea]] is said to contain more than 40% of the world's [[dolmen]], which are mostly concentrated in these three sites.
The [[megalithic]] stones are invaluable because they mark the graves of the ruling elite. Pottery, [[gogok|comma-shaped jewels]], bronzes, stone tools, and other funerary artifacts have been excavated from these dolmen. The culture of the people during this time can be gleaned from the evidence left by the dolmen. Additionally, it can be induced from the stones how the stone was quarried, transported, and used to build the dolmen.
Dolmen in Korea have been dated to the seventh century BCE in locations such as [[Gochang]] and the practice ended around the third century BCE. The dolmen culture is linked with the [[Neolithic]] and bronze cultures of Korea.
Excavation at the sites did not begin until 1965. Since, then multiple digs have been sponsored and an extensive program of inventory and preservation has been initiated by the Korean government.
== Origin == There are three main theories about the origin of the ancient Korean Dolmen. First, the theory that it was spread through the sea in Southeast Asia, secondly, the theory that it was derived from a stone tomb in the north, and third, the theory that it originated in Korea.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://terms.naver.com/entry.nhn?docId=1745075&cid=49373&categoryId=49373&expCategoryId=49373|title=The origin of Korean Dolmen|last=|first=|date=|work=|access-date=2018-11-25|language=ko}}</ref>
=== The theory of spreading from South Asia === It is a theory that the Dolmen spread through Southeast Asia along with the rice culture. Dolmen are distributed along the west coast of Korea and In that the distribution of the Dolmen is consistent with the southern part of the culture, the Dolmen was spread from Southeast Asia along with agriculture.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://news.naver.com/main/read.nhn?mode=LSD&mid=sec&sid1=103&oid=028&aid=0000066125|title=Dolmen is standing on megalithic culture|last=|first=|date=|work=|access-date=2018-11-25|language=ko}}</ref>
=== The theory of spreading from Northern Asia === This theory is derived from the theory that the Dolmen developed from the stone tomb of the Manchuria because it is closely related to the Bronze age culture in the north. If a stone mound is exposed to the ground due to the large size, the stone will be a stone-shaped table. Although it is very persuasive in terms of shape, it is not distributed in northern Asia such as Manchuria and Siberia. <ref>{{Cite news|url=http://news.khan.co.kr/kh_news/khan_art_view.html?artid=201805251814005&code=960100|title=Dolmen - Under 300 tons of rock, the life of the Bronze Age is dormant.|last=|first=|date=2018-05-25|work=|access-date=2018-11-25}}</ref>
=== The theory of originating in Korea === In the background of this theory, the dolmen are the most distributed in Korea. They are also diverse in shape and are timed ahead of those of other countries. It is highly likely that the culture of the South and the North will have developed a unique Dolmen culture in Korea. The peninsula originated from its geographical location, where it provided easy access to the culture of the north and south.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.newscj.com/news/articleView.html?idxno=270173|title=Megalithic culture, Dolmen|last=|first=|date=2014-12-22|work=천지일보|access-date=2018-11-25|language=ko}}</ref>
==Description== Dolmen are generally classified in two types in East Asia. The table/northern-type and the go-board/southern-type. In the former, four stones were positioned to make the walls of a box and were capped by a stone which lay on top of the supports. The latter is characterized by underground burial with stones that supported the capstone.
===Gochang Dolmen Site=== [[File:Korea-Gwangju-Gochang Dolmens 5349-06.JPG|thumb|upright=1.2|One of the tallest Dolmens at Gochang Dolmen site]] This group of dolmen are the largest and most varied. They are known as the Jungnim-ri dolmens and are centered in Maesan village, [[Gochang County]], [[North Jeolla]] province.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://terms.naver.com/entry.nhn?docId=1392236&cid=62346&categoryId=62352|title=Gochang, Hwasun and Ganghwa Dolmen Sites|last=|first=|date=|work=|access-date=2018-11-25|language=ko}}</ref>
The dolmens were built from east to west at the foot of a series of hills at an altitude of 15 to 50 meters/49 feet to 164 feet. Generally, the capstones of the dolmens are around 1 to 5.8 meters/3.2 to 19 feet in length and may weigh up to 225 tons. 442 dolmen have been documented and classified based on the size of the capstone.
This group is believed to have been constructed around the seventh century BCE.
The Gochang Dolmen Site is listed as Historic Site #391.
===Hwasun Dolmen Sites=== [[File:Korea-Hwasun Dolmen sites01.jpg|thumb|upright=1.2|Dolmens at Hwasun Dolmen Site]] Found in [[Hwasun County]], [[South Jeolla]], {{Coord|34.9775414|126.931551|display=inline}}, these dolmens are also located on the slopes of hills and follow the Jiseokgang river. The Hyosan-ri group contains 158 dolmens and the Dasin-ri group, 129. These dolmens are less well preserved than the Jungnim-ri group. The quarry where some of the stones of this group were carved out has been located. This group is dated to around the sixth or fifth century BCE.
===Ganghwa Dolmen Sites=== [[Image:GMJ 0153.jpg|thumb|upright=1.2|An example of a go-board/southern-type dolmen on Ganghwa]] These dolmens are located on [[Ganghwa Island]], [[Ganghwa County]], [[Incheon]]. They are located on the slopes of mountains and are thus higher in elevation than their counterparts. These dolmens are believed to be earliest ones made because the dolmen groups in Bugeun-ri ({{lang|ko-Hang|부근리}}, in Hajeom-myeon) and Gocheon-ri ({{lang|ko-Hang|고천리}}, in Naega-myeon) resemble the early dolmens. However, this has not been conclusively proved.
A notable dolmen at Ganghwa is a northern/table-type dolmen where it was believed ancestral rites were performed. It is the biggest stone in South Korea with measures of 2.6 × 7.1 × 5.5 meters, but it has only two supporting stones. Combined the supporting stones and the capstone weigh between 150 and 225 tons.
==References== {{reflist}}
==See also== {{Commons category|Dolmens in South Korea}} * [[List of Korea-related topics]] * [[Dolmen]] * [[List of megalithic sites]]
==External links== * [http://english.cha.go.kr/ Cultural Heritage] * [https://web.archive.org/web/20070324210503/http://www.heritage.go.kr/eng/her/her_08.jsp Korean National Heritage Online] * [http://whc.unesco.org/pg.cfm?cid=31&id_site=977 UNESCO]

{{EngvarB|date=July 2014}} {{Use dmy dates|date=July 2014}} {{Infobox Government agency |agency_name = Hong Kong Tourism Board |nativename = 香港旅遊發展局 |logo = HKTourismBoard.svg |headquarters = 9-11/F, Citicorp Centre, 18 Whitfield Road, Causeway Bay, Hong Kong |employees = 325 [http://www.discoverhongkong.com/eng/about-hktb/structure-management.html] |budget = HK$613.6m (2008–09) [http://www.discoverhongkong.com/eng/about-hktb/images/2008-2009-16.pdf] |chief1_name = [[Peter Lam]] |chief1_position = Chairman |chief2_name = Anthony Lau [http://www.discoverhongkong.com/eng/about-hktb/executive-director-bio.html] |chief2_position = Executive Director |chief3_name = Becky Ip [http://www.discoverhongkong.com/eng/about-hktb/deputy-executive-director-bio.html] |chief3_position = Deputy Executive Director |website = [http://www.discoverhongkong.com/ DiscoverHongKong.com] }} {{Infobox Chinese |showflag=tp |t=香港旅遊發展局 |p=Xiānggǎng Lǚyóu Fāzhǎnjú |myr=Syānggǎng Lyǔyóu Fājǎnjyú |tp=Siānggǎng Lyǔyóu Fājhǎnjyú |w=Hsiang-kang Lüyu Fachanchü |j=hoeng1 gong2 leoi5 jau4 faat3 zin2 guk6 |y=heūng góng leuíh yaùh faat jín guhk }}
[[File:HongKongTourismBoardHKG.jpg|thumb|Hong Kong Tourism Board at the Hong Kong International Airport]]
The '''Hong Kong Tourism Board (HKTB)''' ([[Traditional Chinese]]: 香港旅遊發展局) is a [[Government of Hong Kong|Government]]-subvented body founded in 2001. The Board replaced the '''Hong Kong Tourist Association (HKTA)''' ([[Traditional Chinese]]: 香港旅遊協會) established in 1957. It has 15 branch offices and representative offices in 6 markets around the world, and its primary mission is to maximise the social and economic contribution that tourism makes to the community of Hong Kong, and consolidate the city's position as a desired destination. In fulfilling this, it works with the Government, [[travel industry]] and other partners to market and promote Hong Kong worldwide, improve the range and quality of visitor facilities and tourism service standards, and enhance the experiences of visitors once they have arrived.
==Visitor centres== * Hong Kong International Airport – Transfer Area and Buffer Halls A and B, Arrivals Level, Terminal 1 * Lo Wu – Arrival Hall, 2/F, Lo Wu Terminal Building, [[Lo Wu Control Point]] * Hong Kong Island – The Peak Piazza * Kowloon – [[Tsim Sha Tsui Ferry Pier|Star Ferry Concourse]], Tsim Sha Tsui
==HKTB Board== The HKTB Board is appointed by the Chief Executive of the Hong Kong SAR Government and is made up of 20 members from various industries. The Commissioner for Tourism, who is an government official, holds the capacity as Deputy Chairman of the HKTB.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.discoverhongkong.com/eng/about-hktb/structure-and-management/hktb-board-members.jsp|title=HKTB Board Members}}</ref>
==Quality Tourism Services (QTS) scheme== Launched in November 1999, the '''Quality Tourism Services (QTS) Scheme''' ([[Traditional Chinese]]: 優質旅遊服務) is an accreditation programme aimed at promoting service excellence among local businesses and assisting customers to identify quality service providers. To qualify, merchant must fulfill stringent criteria and undergo annual assessment. All accredited merchants must display the gold and black QTS sign on their shop windows for recognition.
Initially, shops and restaurants were the only 2 categories covered by the QTS scheme. The scheme was extended to visitor accommodations and hair salons in November 2006 and March 2010 respectively.
As at March 2010, over 7,200 merchant outlets have been accredited under the QTS scheme.<ref>{{cite web| url=http://partnernet.hktb.com/pnweb/jsp/doc/listDoc.jsp?charset=en&doc_id=130857| title=Press Release: HKTB EXTENDS QUALITY TOURISM SERVICES SCHEME TO HAIRDRESSING INDUSTRY| author=Hong Kong Tourism Board| date=1 April 2010}}</ref> The QTS scheme is one of the most successful consumer protection programmes in Hong Kong. The Intellectual Property Department reported in 2008 that 4,700 outlets had joined its "No Fakes Pledge" – another well-known consumer protection programme in the territory.<ref>{{cite web| url=http://www.ipd.gov.hk/eng/pub_press/press_releases/Press_Release_e.pdf| title=Press Release: 10th anniversary celebration of "No Fakes Pledge" scheme| author=Intellectual Property Department| date=19 July 2008}}</ref>
After the launch of the QTS scheme, the use of membership badges bearing the iconic red junk logos of the former HKTA was discontinued in 2000. The HKTA membership badge was first introduced in 1965.<ref>{{cite web| url=http://www.discoverhongkong.com/eng/about-hktb/images/2007-2008-02.pdf| title=HKTB Annual Report 2007/2008 – 50 Years of Hong Kong Tourism| author=Hong Kong Tourism Board| year=2008}}</ref>
===TV commercial=== Starring famous Hong Kong actor/singer/producer [[Andy Lau]], the 2003 commercial was inspired by Lau's 2002 blockbuster movie [[Infernal Affairs]] – a movie about an undercover cop and a bad cop working for the triads. The core message of the commercial is shops selling genuine goods and providing high standard service should set themselves apart from dishonest merchants by getting the QTS accreditation. The commercial has been aired from time to time till these days.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://partnernet.hktb.com/pnweb/jsp/doc/HKTB_listDoc.jsp?charset=&doc_id=61456 |title=Press Release: Quality Tourism Services Scheme Enhancement Ensures Better Protection For Visitors |author=Hong Kong Tourism Board |date=19 December 2003 }}{{dead link|date=April 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref><ref>{{cite web| url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=A3B9a_-lWWE| title=Quality Tourism Services (QTS) Scheme API| author=Hong Kong Tourism Board| year=2003}}</ref>
The QTS commercial is often confused with another [[public service announcement]] (PSA) promoting quality services which was also fronted by Andy Lau. The PSA was filmed in 2002 by the [[Information Services Department]].<ref>{{cite web| url=http://www.info.gov.hk/isd/tvapi/service1/english/high_eng.htm| title=TV Announcement: Success Starts with Quality Service| author=Information Services Department| year=2002}}</ref><ref>{{cite web| url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cF_sRQQS8No| title=優質服務 致勝之道| author=Information Services Department| year=2002}}</ref> There were 5 different versions all featuring rude vs. courteous shop assistants and drivers. Titled "Success Starts with Quality Service" (優質服務 致勝之道), the PSA was a huge success as one of Lau's lines, "Service like this just isn't good enough in today's standard"(今時今日咁嘅服務態度未夠架) has become a popular Hong Konger slang used to describe a poor service or a bad tempered person.
===VIP offers=== Simply by presenting his/her travel document and a copy of QTS promotional leaflet at a participating QTS merchant, visitor could enjoy special privileges ranging from exclusive discount to small gift (e.g. a free silk tee for purchasing a suit at a custom tailor). In addition to displaying the QTS gold and black sign, participating QTS merchants would also display the red VIP Offers sign as recognition. The VIP Offers programme was discontinued on 31 Dec 2008.
===Incidents=== ====3D-GOLD Jewellery ({{sehk|0870}})==== Investigations were launched against one of the 3D-GOLD outlets after 40 customers complained they had been harassed by staff and prevented from leaving the shop. The entire 3D-GOLD chain store was stripped of its QTS status with effect from 1 Dec 2004.<ref>{{cite web| url=http://partnernet.hktb.com/pnweb/jsp/doc/listDoc.jsp?charset=en&doc_id=75710| title=Press Release: Termination of QTS Status of 3D-GOLD| author=Hong Kong Tourism Board| date=23 February 2005}}</ref> This was the first termination in the scheme's history.
The original 3D-GOLD Jewellery Holdings got into more controversies with the sudden death of its chairman, delisting from the stock exchange and it was on the verge of liquidation by the end of 2008. In July 2009, the jeweller was officially taken over by Hong Kong Resources Holdings ({{sehk|2882}}).
The QTS status of the new 3D-GOLD chain was later reinstated after it had passed the assessment.
====Director of Audit's report==== The [[Audit Commission (Hong Kong)|Audit Commission]] carried out a comprehensive audit on the HKTB in 2006 – 07. In the report released in October 2007, an entire section was devoted to the QTS scheme. The commission made 3 recommendations suggesting HKTB should take action to improve the scheme and reduce the number of complaints, explore ways to achieve self-financing and encourage more operators to apply for the QTS Visitor Accommodation Scheme.<ref>{{cite web| url=http://www.aud.gov.hk/pdf_e/e49ch06_sum.pdf| title=Report No. 49 of the Director of Audit| author=Audit Commission| date=October 2007}}</ref> In response, HKTB committed to create more places in the quality training workshops for merchants and co-operate with the [[Home Affairs Department]] to proactively promote QTS Visitor Accommodation Scheme.<ref>{{cite web| url=http://partnernet.hktb.com/pnweb/primg/Summary%20table-E%20Final.pdf| title=Director of Audit No. 49 – Hong Kong Tourism Board Summary of Improvement Measures| author=Hong Kong Tourism Board| date=December 2007}}</ref>
====Bird's nest vendors==== The QTS status of 3 merchants specialised in [[Bird's nest soup|bird's nest]] – a Chinese delicacy – were terminated on 27 July 2007. The 3 merchants had publicly admitted infringement of another merchant's trademark.<ref>{{cite web| url=http://partnernet.hktb.com/pnweb/jsp/doc/listDoc.jsp?charset=en&doc_id=102181| title=Press Release: Statement of Termination| author=Hong Kong Tourism Board| date=27 July 2007}}</ref>
====Outsourcing==== In a bid to save HK$2 million annually (US$256,000) in operating costs, HKTB announced on 5 Nov 2010 that the assessment work of QTS merchants has been outsourced to the [[Hong Kong Productivity Council|Productivity Council]], while the work to engage merchants to offer discounts for visitors has been outsourced to AQ Communications. The saving will fund extra marketing work for the QTS scheme. As a result, the jobs of 17 permanent and contract staff of the Partnership & Quality Tourism Services Department had been made redundant with immediate effect. Only 5 staff would be retained to monitor the outsourced work.<ref name=scmp>{{cite web| url=http://www.scmp.com/portal/site/SCMP/menuitem.2af62ecb329d3d7733492d9253a0a0a0/?vgnextoid=927db64a8fc1c210VgnVCM100000360a0a0aRCRD&ss=Hong+Kong&s=News| title=Tourism Board cutbacks queried| author=South China Morning Post| date=6 November 2010}}</ref>
Local media reported that the staff affected were first notified at 3pm on the same day of the announcement and were asked to leave by day's end. They were given compensation in accordance with the local labour laws but were denied internal transfer to other vacant positions within the organisation.<ref>{{cite web| url=http://hk.apple.nextmedia.com/template/apple/art_main.php?iss_id=20101106&sec_id=4104&subsec=11867&art_id=14632849| title=旅發局縮開支 炒17人| author=Apple Daily| date=6 November 2010}}</ref> A staff had expressed anger at being kept in the dark about the tendering of the outsourced work in a newspaper interview.<ref name=oncc>{{cite web| url=http://orientaldaily.on.cc/cnt/news/20101106/00176_007.html| title=旅發局年尾炒17人| author=Oriental Daily| date=6 November 2010}}</ref>
HKTB Deputy Executive Director Daisy Lam later reiterated to the media at an event launch function that the outsourcing was a result of an organizational review conducted a year ago in 2009.<ref name=hkdn>{{cite web| url=http://www.hkdailynews.com.hk/news.php?id=131184| archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20111006140622/http://www.hkdailynews.com.hk/news.php?id=131184| dead-url=yes| archive-date=6 October 2011| title=「優質旅遊」外判 旅發局17員工遣散| author=Hong Kong Daily News| date=8 November 2010}}</ref>
In an interview to local newspapers, Legislator [[Lee Cheuk-yan]] questioned about the quality of work after the outsourcing.<ref name="scmp"/> Lee also concerned that the affected staff will be unable to secure another job as the end of the year nears. Another lawmaker [[Wong Kwok-hing]] critisied HKTB for setting a bad example and he feared the private sector may follow suit.<ref name="oncc"/>
Daisy Lam responded to critics that in addition to compensation, those affected may consider a transfer to the two outsourced bodies. Lam was not worried others would follow HKTB's move as other companies should make their own judgment call.<ref name="hkdn"/>
==References== {{Reflist|2}}
== External links == {{Commons category}} *[http://www.discoverhongkong.com/eng/index.jsp Hong Kong Tourism Board Official Website] *[http://www.tourism.gov.hk/english/welcome/welcome.html Hong Kong Tourism Commission] *[http://www.tichk.org/public/website/en/index.html Travel Industry Council of Hong Kong] *[https://www.youtube.com/user/HongKong Hong Kong Tourism Board's YouTube Channel] *[http://sunzi1.lib.hku.hk/HKTBC/ Hong Kong Tourism Board Collection] – University of Hong Kong Libraries, Digital Initiatives *[http://www.travelogx.com/hongkong Hong Kong Travel Blogs]

{{url|designtoimprovelife.dk}} | remarks = | formerly = <!-- Any former names by which the organization known --> | footnotes = }} '''INDEX: Design to Improve Life''' is a Danish [[nonprofit organisation]] which works towards promoting designs aimed at the improvement of human lives worldwide, both in developed and [[Developing country|developing countries]]. The organization is behind the biennial INDEX: Award, the world's biggest design award.
==History==
Established in 2002, INDEX: Design to Improve Life was initially proposed by designer [[Johan Adam Linneballe]] and then [[Permanent Secretary]] of the [[Ministry of Economic and Business Affairs (Denmark)|Ministry of Economic and Business Affairs]] {{Interlanguage link multi|Jørgen Rosted|da}} as a world design event in order to promote Denmark on a global scale,<ref name="information1">{{cite news |url = http://www.information.dk/144664 |title = 'INDEX: handler om at forbedre livet for alle mennesker' | Information |language = da |work = [[Dagbladet Information]] |accessdate = 17 August 2015 |deadurl = no |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20160304061737/http://www.information.dk/144664 |archivedate = 4 March 2016 |df = dmy-all }}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url = http://pleasure.borsen.dk/design/artikel/1/212493/designformand_danmark_stadig_en_vigtig_player.html |title = Designformand: Danmark stadig en vigtig player |language = da |work = [[Dagbladet Børsen]] |accessdate = 17 August 2015 |deadurl = no |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20170629231423/http://pleasure.borsen.dk/design/artikel/1/212493/designformand_danmark_stadig_en_vigtig_player.html |archivedate = 29 June 2017 |df = dmy-all }}</ref><ref>{{cite news |author = Solveig Gram Jensen |url = http://politiken.dk/oekonomi/ECE361043/danskere-er-gode-til-at-faa-gode-ideer/ |title = Danskere er gode til at få gode ideer |language = da |work = [[Politiken]] |accessdate = 17 August 2015 |deadurl = no |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20160304134834/http://politiken.dk/oekonomi/ECE361043/danskere-er-gode-til-at-faa-gode-ideer/ |archivedate = 4 March 2016 |df = dmy-all }}</ref> as well as attract tourism and investments.<ref name=hist>{{cite web |url = http://www.indexaward.dk/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=2&Itemid=16 |title = HOME - INDEX: Design to Improve Life® |work = INDEX: Design to Improve Life® |deadurl = no |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20111130034100/http://www.indexaward.dk/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=2&Itemid=16 |archivedate = 30 November 2011 |df = dmy-all }}</ref> However, it soon acquired a global perspective, and its mission has become expressed in its motto: ''"Design to Improve Life"''.<ref name="information1"/><ref name=ex2009>[http://www.presseinitiativet.um.dk/NR/rdonlyres/E980D8D7-F5FE-4DAA-9F04-499FFC667E5E/0/LOFTIndexawards.pdf "INDEX: Design to Improve Life"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110719132538/http://www.presseinitiativet.um.dk/NR/rdonlyres/E980D8D7-F5FE-4DAA-9F04-499FFC667E5E/0/LOFTIndexawards.pdf |date=19 July 2011 }} by Rod Bradbury, 2009</ref>
The organisation is under the patronage of the [[Frederik, Crown Prince of Denmark|Crown Prince]] and [[Frederik, Crown Prince of Denmark|Crown Princess of Denmark]], is supported by the [[Ministry of Economic and Business Affairs (Denmark)|Danish Ministry of Business and Growth]]. INDEX: Design to Improve Life is promoted by means of a design award, the INDEX: Award, a world-touring exhibition, a summer camp, conferences, and publications.<ref name="bwbd">{{cite web | url = http://www.abetterworldbydesign.com/2009/speakers.php | title = 18 of 18 speakers announced | work = A Better World by Design | deadurl = yes | archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20100727081608/http://www.abetterworldbydesign.com/2009/speakers.php | archivedate = 27 July 2010 | accessdate = 31 August 2015 }}</ref> It is headed by Kigge Hvid, former ==INDEX: Award== The biennial INDEX: Award was initiated in 2005, financed by the state of Denmark with a total prize sum of {{Currency|500000|euro}}.<ref>{{cite web |last = Curtis |first = Sam |url = https://www.outputmagazine.com/design/denmark-seeks-designs-that-will-change-the-future-for-2015-index-award |title = Denmark seeks designs that will change the future for 2015 Index Award |work = Output Magazine |date = 16 January 2015 |accessdate = 17 August 2015 |deadurl = no |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20170706175441/https://www.outputmagazine.com/design/denmark-seeks-designs-that-will-change-the-future-for-2015-index-award |archivedate = 6 July 2017 |df = dmy-all }}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url = https://www.nytimes.com/2009/09/21/arts/21iht-design21.html |work = [[The New York Times]] |first = Alice |last = Rawsthorn |title = 'Tis the Season of Festival Mania |date = 20 September 2009 |accessdate = 17 August 2015 |deadurl = no |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20170630122727/http://www.nytimes.com/2009/09/21/arts/21iht-design21.html |archivedate = 30 June 2017 |df = dmy-all }}</ref> It is currently the world's largest monetary award in its area,<ref name="autogenerated1">{{cite news |last = Ponsford |first = Matthew |url = http://edition.cnn.com/2013/08/30/tech/innovation/big-plans-tiny-creations-index-awards/ |title = Big plans, tiny creations win at world's largest design prize |publisher = CNN |date = 30 August 2013 |accessdate = 17 August 2015 |deadurl = no |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20150926032952/http://edition.cnn.com/2013/08/30/tech/innovation/big-plans-tiny-creations-index-awards |archivedate = 26 September 2015 |df = dmy-all }}</ref><ref>{{cite news |author = Soren Petersen |url = http://www.huffingtonpost.com/soren-petersen/index-award---funding-int_b_7481706.html |title = INDEX: AWARD - Funding International Award Winning Design Startups | Soren Petersen |work = [[The Huffington Post]] |date = 1 June 2015 |accessdate = 17 August 2015 |deadurl = no |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20150906215056/http://www.huffingtonpost.com/soren-petersen/index-award---funding-int_b_7481706.html |archivedate = 6 September 2015 |df = dmy-all }}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url = https://www.nytimes.com/2011/07/25/arts/italian-designers-create-objects-to-recall-the-past.html |work = The New York Times |first = Alice |last = Rawsthorn |title = Italian Designers Create Objects to Recall the Past |date = 24 July 2011 |deadurl = no |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20170630121849/http://www.nytimes.com/2011/07/25/arts/italian-designers-create-objects-to-recall-the-past.html |archivedate = 30 June 2017 |df = dmy-all }}</ref> is widely recognized as the most influential in inspiring life-improving design,<ref>{{cite news |author = Catherine Shaw |url = http://www.scmp.com/lifestyle/interiors-living/article/1092285/danes-highlight-business-design-week |title = Danes the highlight of Business of Design Week |work = [[South China Morning Post]] |accessdate = 17 August 2015 |deadurl = no |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20161220155645/http://www.scmp.com/lifestyle/interiors-living/article/1092285/danes-highlight-business-design-week |archivedate = 20 December 2016 |df = dmy-all }}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url = http://www.huffingtonpost.com/soren-petersen/the-index-award-and-why-i_b_7566766.html |title = The INDEX: Award and Why It Matters for Innovation | Soren Petersen |work = [[The Huffington Post]] |date = 12 June 2015 |accessdate = 17 August 2015 |deadurl = no |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20150627140600/http://www.huffingtonpost.com/soren-petersen/the-index-award-and-why-i_b_7566766.html |archivedate = 27 June 2015 |df = dmy-all }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url = http://www.b.dk/mode/kigge-hvid-ambitioner-paa-verdens-vegne |title = Kigge Hvid: Ambitioner på verdens vegne - Mode |language = da |work = [[Berlingske Tidende]] |accessdate = 17 August 2015 |deadurl = no |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20170710054756/https://www.b.dk/mode/kigge-hvid-ambitioner-paa-verdens-vegne |archivedate = 10 July 2017 |df = dmy-all }}</ref> and has often been dubbed the "[[Nobel Prize]] of design".<ref>{{cite book |title = Communication Arts |url = https://books.google.com/books?id=tHNLAQAAIAAJ |year = 2006 |publisher = Coyne & Blanchard |page = 36 |quote = ... the patronage of HRH Crown Prince Frederik of Denmark," and described by some as the "Nobel Prize" of the design ... |deadurl = no |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20180226044551/https://books.google.com/books?id=tHNLAQAAIAAJ |archivedate = 26 February 2018 |df = dmy-all }}</ref><ref>{{cite book |title = Designmatters |url = https://books.google.com/books?id=qDZJAQAAIAAJ |series = 9-12 |year = 2005 |publisher = Designmatters ApS |page = 10 |quote = ... INDEX: Award, which has already been dubbed the Nobel Prize of the design world. |deadurl = no |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20180226044551/https://books.google.com/books?id=qDZJAQAAIAAJ |archivedate = 26 February 2018 |df = dmy-all }}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.emsworld.com/news/10409912/bio-cybernetics-internationals-mat-tourniquet-nominated-for-index-award | title = Bio Cybernetics International's MAT Tourniquet Nominated for INDEX Award | publisher = Emsworld.com | date = 21 December 2006 | accessdate = 17 August 2015 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url = http://www.designstores.gr/worlds-largest-design-award-to-the-invisible-airbag-bicycle-helmet-hovding.html |title = World's largest design award to the invisible airbag bicycle helmet Hövding | Art and Design News |publisher = Designstores.gr |date = 20 June 2014 |accessdate = 17 August 2015 |deadurl = yes |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20160304074147/http://www.designstores.gr/worlds-largest-design-award-to-the-invisible-airbag-bicycle-helmet-hovding.html |archivedate = 4 March 2016 |df = dmy-all }}</ref> British design critic [[Alice Rawsthorn]] in 2011, wrote for ''[[The New York Times]]'', "Not only is INDEX: the world's most generous design prize in financial terms, it is one of the few awards to have made a meaningful contribution to design discourse."<ref name="nytimes1">{{cite news |last = Rawsthorn |first = Alice |title = This Contest Takes the Prize |url = https://www.nytimes.com/2011/09/05/arts/design/the-index-design-award-takes-the-prize.html |accessdate = 17 August 2015 |work = [[The New York Times]] |date = 4 September 2011 |quote = Not only is INDEX: the world’s most generous design prize in financial terms, it is one of the few awards to have made a meaningful contribution to design discourse. There are countless design prizes worldwide, yet despite their grandiose claims, many of them are indistinguishable. |deadurl = no |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20150419215407/http://www.nytimes.com/2011/09/05/arts/design/the-index-design-award-takes-the-prize.html |archivedate = 19 April 2015 |df = dmy-all }}</ref>
Projects from around the world are entered into competition for the award with finalists and winners determined by an international jury. In addition to choosing the successful designs, the INDEX: Award Jury plays a key role in the organization, discussing, evaluating and advocating for strategies to expand the borders and impact of design in the world. The INDEX: Award Presentation has become a major event, with an exhibition of the finalists sited in public squares of hosting cities.<ref name=ex2009/>
===2005 winners=== The first INDEX: Award was announced in September 2004,<ref>{{cite news |url = http://www.business.dk/diverse/design-skal-vise-sit-vaerd |title = Design skal vise sit værd | Berlingske Business |language = da |publisher = Business.dk |date = 13 August 2015 |accessdate = 17 August 2015 |deadurl = no |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20170702032320/http://www.business.dk/diverse/design-skal-vise-sit-vaerd |archivedate = 2 July 2017 |df = dmy-all }}</ref> and the competition received 538 entries representing 50 countries,<ref>{{cite news |url = http://www.gizmag.com/go/4535/ |title = The trioBike: ingenious triple play inner urban transport |publisher = Gizmag.com |accessdate = 17 August 2015 |deadurl = no |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20160304091400/http://www.gizmag.com/go/4535/ |archivedate = 4 March 2016 |df = dmy-all }}</ref> of which the INDEX: Award Jury chaired by [[Arnold Wasserman]] selected 118 finalists to participate in the INDEX: Award Exhibition.<ref name="ico-d1">{{cite web |url = http://www.ico-d.org/connect/index/post/1770.php |title = 2011 INDEX: winners announced |publisher = ico-D |date = 1 September 2011 |accessdate = 17 August 2015 |deadurl = no |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20160304094858/http://www.ico-d.org/connect/index/post/1770.php |archivedate = 4 March 2016 |df = dmy-all }}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url = http://www.b.dk/kultur/118-projekter-indstillet-til-designpriser |title = 118 projekter indstillet til designpriser - ===2007 winners=== In 2007, INDEX: Award received 337 entries, of which the INDEX: Award Jury chaired by [[Nille Juul-Sørensen]] selected 112 for nomination,<ref>{{cite news |url = http://www.information.dk/136928 |title = 112 designeksempler nomineret til INDEX-prisen 2007 | Information |language = da |work = Dagbladet Information |accessdate = 17 August 2015 |deadurl = no |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20160304071216/http://www.information.dk/136928 |archivedate = 4 March 2016 |df = dmy-all }}</ref> and 110 were exhibited on [[Kongens Nytorv]].<ref>{{cite web |url = https://www.dexigner.com/news/11411 |title = World's Biggest Design Award Presented in Copenhagen |publisher = Dexigner.com |date = 29 June 2007 |accessdate = 17 August 2015 |deadurl = no |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20160304202448/http://www.dexigner.com/news/11411 |archivedate = 4 March 2016 |df = dmy-all }}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url = https://www.computerworld.dk/art/41010/olpc-vinder-international-designpris |title = OLPC vinder international designpris - "Tongue Sucker", a simple device, easy to use in an emergency to draw out the tongue of an unconscious person, make the airway unobstructed and hence assist CPR in time-critical situations.<ref name="Berger2010">{{cite book | author = Warren Berger | title = CAD Monkeys, Dinosaur Babies, and T-Shaped People: Inside the World of Design Thinking and How It Can Spark Creativity and Innovati on | url = https://books.google.com/books?id=JO0OV7uffc8C&pg=PT232 | date = 28 December 2010 | publisher = Penguin Publishing Group | isbn = 978-1-101-47806-6 | pages = 232– | quote = ... of international design competitions that focus on life-improving design, including the Denmark-based INDEX: AWARD ... awarded prizes for a bottle that uses solar energy to clean water and a small first aid tool called the Tongue Sucker, ... }}</ref><ref>{{cite news |author = Gwladys Fouché |url = https://www.theguardian.com/society/2007/aug/24/health.medicineandhealth |title = Tongue sucker wins design prize for Brits | Society |work = The Guardian |accessdate = 17 August 2015 |deadurl = no |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20160305091301/http://www.theguardian.com/society/2007/aug/24/health.medicineandhealth |archivedate = 5 March 2016 |df = dmy-all }}</ref><ref>{{cite news |author = Pelle Ammundsen |url = http://www.avisen.dk/studerende-vinder-verdens-stoerste-designpris_64877.aspx |title = Studerende vinder verdens største designpris |language = da |publisher = Avisen.dk |date = 25 August 2007 |accessdate = 17 August 2015 |deadurl = no |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20160304103900/http://www.avisen.dk/studerende-vinder-verdens-stoerste-designpris_64877.aspx |archivedate = 4 March 2016 |df = dmy-all }}</ref> *Play Category: [[Elon Musk]], [[Martin Eberhard]] and Barney Hatt - Michael Bove, [[Yves Behar]], Sergio Romero de Azevedo, [[Walter Bender]], [[Michail Bletsas]], Mark Foster, Jacques Gagne, Mary Lou Jepson, [[Nicholas Negroponte]] and [[Lisa Strausfeld]] - the affordable "[[XO laptop]]"<ref>{{cite news |last = Swengley |first = Nicole |url = https://www.wsj.com/articles/SB10001424053111903791504576588303826193800 |title = Wearing a Philanthropic Heart on Their Designs |work = The Wall Street Journal |date = 30 September 2011 |accessdate = 17 August 2015 |deadurl = no |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20160305112043/http://www.wsj.com/articles/SB10001424053111903791504576588303826193800 |archivedate = 5 March 2016 |df = dmy-all }}</ref><ref name="Hudson2009">{{cite book |author = Thames & Hudson |title = 60: Innovators Shaping Our Creative Future |url = https://books.google.com/books?id=HcQzAQAAIAAJ |year = 2009 |publisher = Thames & Hudson |isbn = 978-0-500-51492-4 |page = 402 |deadurl = no |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20171003070831/https://books.google.com/books?id=HcQzAQAAIAAJ |archivedate = 3 October 2017 |df = dmy-all }}</ref> *People's Choice Award: Han Pham - "Antivirus", a cap to be placed onto a soda can to be used for safe disposal of [[hypodermic needle]]s in low income countries, where these needles are commonly found in trash and thus increase the rates of transmission of diseases and needle injuries.<ref name="AlesinaLupton2010">{{cite book | author1 = Inna Alesina | author2 = Ellen Lupton | title = Exploring Materials: Creative Design for Everyday Objects | url = https://books.google.com/books?id=ccQrBVUWT8EC&pg=PA54 | date = 24 March 2010 | publisher = Princeton Architectural Press | isbn = 978-1-56898-768-2 | pages = 54– }}</ref><ref name="Pilloton2009">{{cite book | author = Emily Pilloton | title = Design Revolution: 100 Products that are Changing People's Lives | url = https://books.google.com/books?id=F_5LAQAAIAAJ | year = 2009 | publisher = Thames & Hudson | isbn = 978-0-500-28840-5 | page = 90 }}</ref>

===2011 winners=== In 2011, INDEX: Award received 966 entries from 78 countries, of which the INDEX: Award Jury chaired by Nille Juul-Sørensen selected 58 for nomination and participation in the INDEX: Award Exhibition outside the [[Royal Danish Playhouse]] on the harbor front in the [[Frederiksstaden]] neighbourhood of [[Indre By|central]] Copenhagen.<ref name="ico-d1"/><ref>{{cite web |url = http://designtoimprovelife.dk/category/award2011/ |title = INDEX: AWARD 2011 Archives - INDEX: Design to Improve Life® |publisher = Designtoimprovelife.dk |date = 1 September 2011 |accessdate = 17 August 2015 |deadurl = no |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20150822182250/http://designtoimprovelife.dk/category/award2011/ |archivedate = 22 August 2015 |df = dmy-all }}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url = http://www.dr.dk/arkivP1/Vita/Udsendelser/2011/09/02113825.htm |title = Skønheden i det nødvendige - dr.dk/arkivP1/Vita/Udsendelser |language = da |publisher = [[DR (broadcaster)|DR]] |date = 2 September 2011 |accessdate = 17 August 2015 |deadurl = yes |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20150831094509/http://www.dr.dk/arkivP1/Vita/Udsendelser/2011/09/02113825.htm |archivedate = 31 August 2015 |df = dmy-all }}</ref> The winners announced at the award ceremony at the [[Copenhagen Opera House]] on 1 September were:<ref>{{cite news |author = Andreas Thorsen |url = http://politiken.dk/kultur/ECE1379942/verdens-foerste-cykelairbag-vinder-kaempe-designpris/ |title = Verdens første cykelairbag vinder kæmpe designpris |language = da |work = Politiken |accessdate = 17 August 2015 |deadurl = no |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20160304190622/http://politiken.dk/kultur/ECE1379942/verdens-foerste-cykelairbag-vinder-kaempe-designpris/ |archivedate = 4 March 2016 |df = dmy-all }}</ref>
